alert.note: Alert for Blount (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 5:29PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Blount County through 600 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cleveland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Blountsville, Cleveland, Altoona, Snead, Susan Moore, Walnut Grove, Allgood, Fairview, Nectar, Rosa, Easley, Fowler Spring and Hendrix. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central and northeastern Alabama.
